reasoning.correctness: Gold Answer identifies COVID-19 as the diagnosis investigated, with evidence including hospital work, flu-like symptoms, persistent cough, coworker concerns, PPE use, and timing; Generated Answer correctly identifies COVID-19 and negative result, mentions hospital work and colleague alarm accurately, but has minor citation errors (D-35 instead of P-34/P-35); core facts match without contradictions.
reasoning.completeness: Gold key points: COVID-19 diagnosis, patient disclosure [P-35], hospital work [P-34/P-17], occupational exposure, flu-like symptoms [P-13/P-14], persistent cough, coworkers scared [P-35], PPE/careful [P-17], test timing [P-36], negative result, stayed home [P-36]. Generated covers: diagnosis, hospital work, coworker alarm (tied to cough), negative result. Missed: flu-like symptoms, PPE, test timing, stayed home, explicit disclosure/occupational exposure detail. Covers ~30-40% of key points.
reasoning.faithfulness: All claims in Generated verifiable in transcript: hospital clerk [P-34], scared at work when coughing [P-35], COVID test negative [P-35]; citations inaccurate (D-35 vs P-34/P-35/P-36) but refer to adjacent dialogue; no hallucinations, fully grounded.
reasoning.relevance: Generated Answer directly structures response to match question components (diagnosis, evidence, testing result) with no off-topic content, perfectly focused.

summary: The Generated Answer is factually accurate and relevant but incomplete in covering the full range of evidence and details from the Gold Answer, with minor citation issues.
